articles.name: Unauthorized Transactions Suspension FAQ
articles.title: Unauthorized Transactions Suspension FAQ
articles.body:
Abusing or defrauding Discord or our payment system violates our Terms of Service.

When we receive a fraud report from a payment method owner regarding a purchase made on Discord, we take that seriously. These reports indicate that the transaction was reported as unauthorized or unrecognized.

In response, we may suspend your account to protect our platform from potential abuse, fraud, or misuse of our payment systems. This is done in line with our responsibility to maintain a safe and secure environment for all users.

If your account has already been suspended for this violation, you can appeal by submitting a request to Discord's Trust & Safety Team at dis.gd/request.

What this article covers:

  • How do I appeal an unauthorized transaction suspension?
  • How can I avoid an unauthorized transaction in the future?
  • For More Information

How do I appeal an unauthorized transaction suspension?

If you believe this action was taken in error, you can submit an appeal within 48 hours of receiving the suspension notice.

To appeal a suspension, follow the steps below:

1. Visit https://dis.gd/request

2. Select Appeals & Age Update Requests as the request type from the “How can we help?” dropdown menu

3. In the “What would you like to appeal?” section, select An action taken on my account.

4. Include one of the following with your appeal:

  • A screenshot of your most recent Discord transaction(s) from your billing statement
    • Please ensure the screenshot displays the amount and date of transaction along with the descriptor.
  • OR, A photo of the card (physical or virtual) used on Discord
    • All digits must be obscured except the last 4
    • Include a note in the photo showing your full Discord username and the current date
Important: If you're not the cardholder, the person who owns the payment method must withdraw all open fraud report requests within 48 hours to restore account access.

How can I avoid an unauthorized transaction in the future?

Only use payment methods that you are authorized to use.

Before submitting a fraud report to Discord, we recommend:

  • Reviewing your Discord account(s) to make sure the charges are not on an account you own
  • Or reaching out to any family members who you may have previously authorized to use your payment method/card

If you notice any unauthorized charge(s) on your Discord account, please refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information.

For More Information

To learn more about Discord policies on fraudulent activity, check out these resources below:

  • Discord’s Terms of Service

  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions

articles.name: Fraudulent Charge Suspension FAQ
articles.title: Fraudulent Charge Suspension FAQ
articles.body:
Abusing or defrauding Discord or our payment system violates our Terms of Service.

If your account was suspended for Fraudulent Charge, it means our systems identified fraudulent activity related to payments made through your account.

We take these violations seriously. When Discord detects or is notified of fraud linked to an account, we may suspend the account to maintain a safe and secure environment for our community while preventing potential abuse or fraud through our payment systems.

What this article covers:

  • Discord’s Policy on Fraudulent Charges
  • How do I appeal a fraudulent charge suspension?
  • How can I avoid a fraudulent charge suspension in the future?
  • For More Information

Discord’s Policy on Fraudulent Charges

Don’t use the services to do harm to Discord.

Among other things, this includes trying to gain access to or attacking our systems, scraping our services without our written consent, transmitting viruses or other malicious code to our services, abusing or defrauding us or our payment systems, copying our product or using our intellectual property without permission, and misusing our reporting or customer service mechanisms.

How do I appeal a fraudulent charge suspension?

If your account has been found in violation of our Terms of Service due to a Fraudulent Charge, the suspension is considered permanent and is not eligible for appeal.

How can I avoid a fraudulent charge suspension in the future?

Only use payment methods that you are authorized to use.

For More Information

To learn more about Discord policies on fraudulent activity, check out these resources below:

  • Discord’s Terms of Service
  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions

articles.name: Shop Sale FAQ
articles.title: Shop Sale FAQ
articles.body:
From August 27, 2025 through September 3, 2025 (5:00PM UTC), select users can enjoy an exclusive discount on popular Shop items including Avatar Decorations, Profile Effects, and more.

What this article covers:

  • What is the Shop Sale?
  • Who Can Access the Discord Shop Sale?
  • What Discord Shop Items Are On Sale?
  • How to Shop the Discord Sale
    • Step-by-Step Shopping Guide
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is the Shop Sale?

Starting August 27, 2025 until September 3, 2025 (5:00PM UTC), select users will be able to enjoy a discounted Shop item for a limited time. 

Who Can Access the Discord Shop Sale?

This promotion is available to select Discord users on the desktop app only. Eligible users will receive an exclusive discount on their first qualifying Shop item purchase. 

How to know if you're eligible:

  • You'll see discount percentages displayed on eligible items
  • A promotional banner will appear in the Shop tab
  • A special "OFFER" badge will be visible on the Shop tab

What Discord Shop Items Are On Sale?

Items Included in the Sale:

  • Avatar Decorations (Discord-made)
  • Profile Effects (Discord-made)
  • Bundles
  • Shop gifts

The following items are not eligible for the discount:

  • Third-party Shop items
  • Orbs and any items purchased with Orbs
  • Items you already own
  • Select Shop items (as marked)

How to Shop the Discord Sale

Step-by-Step Shopping Guide:

Note: The Shop Sale Discount will only apply to the first eligible Shop item you choose to purchase.

1. Check your eligibility: If you're part of this promotion, you'll see discount indicators on eligible items and promotional banners in the Shop

2. Browse sale items: Open the Shop in Discord's desktop app or browser and look for discount percentage labels on eligible Shop items

3. Make your purchase: The discount will automatically apply at checkout for your eligible item purchase 

Note: Your discount expires when the promotion ends on September 3, 2025 (5:00PM UTC), regardless of when you first see it.

Look for Shop items with green discount indicators to take advantage of special sale prices

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is the Shop discount available on multiple purchases?

A: No, eligible users will receive an exclusive discount on their first qualifying Shop item purchase only. The discount cannot be applied to subsequent purchases.

Q: Why don't I see the Shop Sale discounts?

A: This sale is available to select users only. If you don't see promotional banners, discount labels, or countdown timers in your Shop, you're not part of this particular sale. Discord will be running future promotions in the Shop, so stay tuned for more! 

Q: Can I use my discount on mobile? 

A: No, the Shop sale is only available on desktop. You'll need to use Discord's desktop app or web version to access the discounted pricing.

Q: Can I combine Orbs with my Shop Sale discount?

A: Unfortunately, items purchased with Orbs are not eligible for the Shop sale. You'll need to use a credit card, PayPal, or other standard payment method.

Q: What happens if I don't use my discount? 

A: Your discount will expire when the promotion ends on September 3, 2025 (5:00PM UTC), regardless of when you first saw it. Make sure to complete your purchase before the deadline!

Q: Can I gift discounted items to friends during the Shop Sale?

A: Yes! Gifting is fully supported during the Discord Shop Sale. However, the discount only applies to your first qualifying purchase. If you've already used your discount, it won't apply when gifting items later.

articles.name: Early Fraud Warning (EFW) Suspensions FAQ
articles.title: Early Fraud Warning (EFW) Suspensions FAQ
articles.body:
Abusing or defrauding Discord or our payment system violates our Terms of Service.

When we receive a fraud report from your financial institution about a purchase made on Discord, we may suspend your account to protect you, our community, and our payment systems from potential abuse.

To avoid violating this policy, please direct all refund, fraud, or billing inquiries to our support team at dis.gd/billing instead of contacting your financial institution.

If your account has already been suspended for this violation, you can appeal by submitting a request to Discord's Trust & Safety Team at dis.gd/request.

What this article covers:

  • What is an Early Fraud Warning (EFW)?
  • Why did I get an EFW notice?
  • What happens after an Early Fraud Warning?
    • For Low-Risk Early Fraud Warnings
    • For High-Risk Early Fraud Warnings
  • How can I avoid an EFW or suspension?
  • What should I do if I think an EFW notice is wrong?
    • For Low-Risk EFWs
    • For High-Risk EFWs

What is an Early Fraud Warning (EFW)?

An Early Fraud Warning (EFW) is a notification Discord receives from your financial institution (such as your bank or card issuer) that one or more transactions made on your Discord account were reported as potentially fraudulent.

This does not always mean your account has been compromised, but it does indicate your payment method was flagged for unusual or suspicious activity.

We take these reports seriously to protect both you and our community from potential fraud and abuse.

Why did I get an EFW notice?

You may have received an EFW notice because:

  • A purchase on your account was reported to Discord as fraudulent by your bank or card issuer.
  • Your payment method was reported to Discord as being used without your authorization.
  • Your account may have been compromised, and someone else made purchases without permission.
  • A billing dispute or refund request was filed with your bank instead of contacting Discord Support.

What happens after an Early Fraud Warning?

There are two possible outcomes:

For Low-Risk Early Fraud Warnings:

  • You’ll receive an email notifying you of the fraud report.
  • If the report was made in error, contact your financial institution to resolve it.
  • Additional fraud reports in the future may lead to account suspension for review.
  • Filing chargebacks or refund requests directly with your bank may also result in account suspension. For more details, review our Chargebacks FAQ.
Important: If you have received this low-risk violation, no immediate action is required from you.
However, if fraud has occurred on your account or payment source, please submit a support inquiry directly to Discord. You can refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information.

For High-Risk Early Fraud Warnings:

  • Your account will be suspended pending further investigation.
  • You’ll receive an email explaining the suspension and instructions for appeal.
  • To appeal, submit a request via dis.gd/request and select Appeals & Age Update Requests under What can we help you with?.
  • Please make sure to include the following in your appeal:
    • The reason for the fraud report
    • Evidence of withdrawal (if applicable)
    • A screenshot of the reported transaction from your billing statement (amount, date, descriptor)
Note: Discord receipts are not accepted as proof of payment. Screenshots must be from your payment source.

How can I avoid an EFW or suspension?

  • Use payment methods that you are authorized to use
  • Keep your Discord account secure with Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
  • If you have billing issues, contact Discord Support instead of filing a dispute with your bank
  • Monitor your account activity regularly for unauthorized charges

What should I do if I think an EFW notice is wrong?

For Low-Risk EFWs:

  • Contact your bank to resolve the report. If you have billing concerns, reach out to Discord Support.

For High-Risk EFWs:

  • Follow the appeal process in your suspension email.

For more information, see these resources:

  • Discord’s Terms of Service
  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions
  • Chargebacks FAQ

articles.name: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Customers of Select Drop.com Products
articles.title: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Customers of Select Drop.com Products
articles.body:
Starting from August 7, 2025 (6:00AM PT) to August 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT), Drop.com customers can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro from purchasing eligible Drop.com products. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro subscription or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. 

We may add additional restrictions from time to time, if you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro subscription, redeeming this promotion will override that subscription.

We will not be able to refund any leftover subscription time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing subscription when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim the promo by purchasing eligible Drop.com products starting August 7, 2025 (6:00AM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Subscription: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro subscription will convert to a monthly recurring subscription, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:

  • Promotion Summary
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Drop.com?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Drop.com product? 
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Subscriber?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Subscription Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our Subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Drop.com?

Drop is a passionate group of creators who tap into the feedback and insights from its enthusiast community—millions strong—to design and curate a unique selection of enthusiast products.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Drop.com product?

 Step 1 - Purchase and Add the Offer: 

  • Purchase a qualifying product/SKU on Drop.com and the deal will automatically be added to your cart. 

Step 2 - Check Your Shipping Confirmation

  • Within 24 hours of placing your order containing an eligible product, you'll receive an email from Drop.com containing a redemption link. Select this redemption link to proceed to the next step. 

Step 3 - Redeem Your Code

  • Follow the instructions to redeem your Nitro Trial code within Discord and start enjoying your month of Nitro.

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro subscription or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro subscription, redeeming this promotion will override that subscription.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro subscription on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Info:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Logging into Discord

  • If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Step 2 - Claiming your promotion gift

Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.

  • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________"
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 

Info:

- If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 3 - Redeeming your promotion gift

1 Month of Nitro Gift

Review the details of the promotion then press on Next. Please note: if you switch to a different account at this step, you will not be able to claim and redeem the promotion on the account you switched to. 

Payment Details Review

Make sure your payment information is accurate. If your Discord account does not have your payment information, please fill out your payment details. You will not be charged until the trial ends and the subscription renews.

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the confirmation button.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Subscriber? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro subscription, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro subscription.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro subscription per month unless you cancel your subscription.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT). 

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Subscription Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Drop.com customers can purchase eligible Drop.com products starting on August 7, 2025 (6:00AM PT) through August 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT). The 1-month Nitro promotion must be redeemed by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT). 

After September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT), Drop.com customers will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by September 7, 2026 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Drop.com purchase?

A: Eligible Drop.com customers who purchase an eligible Drop.com product can claim this promotion. Simply add a qualifying product/SKU to your cart on Drop.com. Within 24 hours of a qualifying order, you'll receive an email with a redemption link that takes you directly to Discord to complete the process. Find more detailed redemption steps here.  

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro subscription on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro subscription and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost subscription? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro subscription,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro subscription.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro subscription per month unless you cancel your subscription.

Payment Info and Subscription Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a subscription plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro subscription at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro subscription so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: What should I do if I'm experiencing issues with my Drop.com purchase?

A: Contact Drop.com's support team directly through https://helpdesk.drop.com/hc/en-us for assistance with any purchase-related issues.

articles.name: Discord Display Name Styles FAQ
articles.title: Discord Display Name Styles FAQ
articles.body:
Looking to make your display name stand out on Discord? Display Name Styles is a new Nitro feature that lets you customize how your display name appears with unique fonts, colors, and animated effects. Express your personality with the same display name, just a fresh new look.

What this article covers:

  • What are Display Name Styles?
  • How to Access Display Name Styles
  • Where Display Name Styles Appear
  • How to Set Your Display Name Style Options
    • Fonts
    • Effects
    • Colors
    • Surprise Me Feature
    • Light/Dark Mode Preview
  • Disabling Display Name Styles

What are Display Name Styles?

Display Name Styles allow Discord Nitro users to customize how their display names appear on Discord. With this feature, you can personalize your display name through various styling options including fonts, colors, and effects.

How to Access Display Name Styles

Important: Display Name Styles is currently an experimental feature available to select Nitro subscribers on desktop and browser only.

  • Fonts only work for Nitro subscribers in the experiment who use languages with the Latin alphabet and have set a Latin-based language in their Discord app.
  • Some symbols may not display as expected with custom fonts and will automatically fall back to gg sans for optimal display. 

1. Head into your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] next to your username. 

2. Select Profiles > Display Name Styles. 

3. Press the Change Style button to open the Change Display Name Styles menu. 

Find Display Name Styles in User Settings > Profiles > Display Name Styles

Where Display Name Styles Appear

Note: Display Name Styles appear in multiple locations throughout Discord, with some visibility variations during the experimental phase. Some users may only see Display Name Styles in profiles, while others may see them in multiple locations.

Display Name Styles appear in the following locations:

  • Profile Panel and User Profile - Your Display Name Style appears in your profile panel located in the bottom-left area and your User Profile. 

Display Name Styles in User Profile

  • Direct Messages (DM) and Group Chats - Your Display Name Style appears fully in all DM and group chat member lists. However, in messages, Display Name Styles will only show the font unless you hover over the message.

Display Name Styles in a Group Chat

  • DM List: Your Display Name Style appears in the DM list, but only the font is visible. To see the color or effect, hover over the user.

Display Name Styles in DM List

  • Per-Server Profiles - Your display name style will remain consistent across all per-server profiles. While you can customize each profile separately, the display name style will stay the same.

Display Name Styles in Different Per-Server Profiles

  • Servers - Fonts are displayed, but color and effect settings will not appear in servers. Instead, the server role color or enhanced role style in that server will show. 

Display Name Styles in a Server

How to Set Your Display Name Style Options

Display Name Styles allow you to personalize your display name with three customization components:

Fonts

Choose from 8 unique fonts:

  • gg sans (Discord's default font)
  • Tempo
  • Sakura
  • Jellybean
  • Modern
  • Medieval
  • 8Bit
  • Vampyre

Different Fonts Available

Effects

Select from 5 effect options:

  • Solid
  • Gradient
  • Neon
  • Toon
  • Pop

Different Effects Available

Tip: Selecting the Gradient effect enables you to choose two colors.

 

Color Presets and Color Pickers for Gradient Effect

Colors

Choose from preset options or use the color picker for enhanced color customization:

  • Preset color options: Select any color from the preset palette.
  • Custom color picker: Select the Custom Color option to create your own shade.
  • Default: Select the Default box to revert your color to the default. When using the Solid effect, choosing Default color gives you the option to apply no color at all. When using Gradient effect, there’s no Default color option. 

Select Color from Presets or Color Picker

Tip: Reset your color selection to Default by pressing the Default box.

Default Box under Choose Color

Surprise Me Feature

Use the Surprise Me button to get random font, color, and effect combinations for inspiration.

Surprise Me Button

Light/Dark Mode Preview

Toggle between light and dark mode preview to see how your Display Name Style looks in both themes before applying your changes.

Light and Dark Mode Preview Buttons

Disabling Display Name Styles

If you prefer not to see Display Name Styles from yourself and other users, go to your User Settings > App Settings. Then select Accessibility and disable the Display Name Styles toggle. This will prevent you from seeing Display Name Styles across Discord.

To Disable Display Name Styles, Go to User Settings > Accessibility

articles.name: How to Request a Refund for a Subscription Renewal on a Discord Account You Can’t Access
articles.title: How to Request a Refund for a Subscription Renewal on a Discord Account You Can’t Access
articles.body:
If you need assistance because you’re being charged for a Discord subscription but can’t access your account to cancel it, you’re in the right place. This commonly happens when you've either: 

  • Lost access to the email address associated with the Discord account, or
  • Forgotten the email address used for the Discord account

We'll walk you through the steps to regain control of your subscription and stop unwanted charges, even without direct account access.

Important: Please contact our billing team before filing a dispute with your bank. Filing a dispute or refund request directly with your bank for any Discord transactions may result in account suspension pending further investigation. 
For more information, please review our Chargeback FAQ.

What this article covers:

  • What To Check First
  • How to Submit a Refund Request for a Subscription Renewal on a Discord Account You Can’t Access
  • What to Include in Your Support Request

What To Check First

Before submitting a support request, take a moment to review your recent transactions and purchases. Follow these steps to identify the Discord charges to ensure we provide the right assistance:

  • Look for "DISCORD*" or "PAYPAL DISCORD" on your bank statement—these are the official Discord payment descriptors.
  • For any unrecognized purchases made on Discord using your iOS device, you will need to request a refund for those purchases directly from the iOS App Store.
  • For any unrecognized purchases made on Discord using Google Play, you will also need to request a refund directly from the Google Play Store.

How to Submit a Refund Request for a Subscription Renewal on a Discord Account You Can’t Access

Submitting your request with accurate information will help us route your request to the appropriate support team and resolve your issue faster.

1. In the support form, select "I want a refund for a subscription purchase” under Type of Billing Issue.
2. Under "Do you still have access to this email address?":

  • Select “Yes” if you still have access to the email address associated with the Discord account.
  • Select “No” if you do not have access to the email address associated with the Discord account.
Any refunds outside our standard refund policy may result in disabling your Discord account per our terms.

What to Include in Your Support Request

To help us resolve your case quickly, please provide:

  • Transaction date and amount
  • Purchase method (iOS App Store, Google Play Store, Other)
  • Payment method (credit card, PayPal, Cash App, Venmo, etc.)
  • Payment identifier (e.g., last 4 digits of credit card, PayPal invoice ID, $Cashtag, or Venmo User ID, etc.)
  • Screenshots of the Discord charges on your bank statement or PayPal statement

Please ensure the screenshot or photo displays the amount, date of transaction, and the merchant descriptor showing as DISCORD* or PAYPAL DISCORD on your bank statement.

For security and privacy reasons, unless you are writing in from the Discord account associated with the unrecognized charges, we do not accept Discord receipts as proof of payment. This screenshot must be directly from the payment source.

Any missing payment information may delay the resolution of your case.

Example of Submitting a Support Request

While we aim to resolve requests within 72 hours, some cases may take longer. To ensure the fastest possible response, please submit only one support ticket per issue—multiple tickets can delay our response time.

For more information, see these resources:

  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions
  • Discord’s Refund Policy
  • Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
  • Chargebacks FAQ

These resources cover unrecognized transactions, refund policies, and safe shopping practices on Discord.

articles.name: How to Report Unauthorized Discord Charges Made by Someone You Know
articles.title: How to Report Unauthorized Discord Charges Made by Someone You Know
articles.body:
If someone you know, including a family member, friend, partner, etc., has used your payment information to make a purchase on their Discord account without your authorization, we’re here to help.

Before you proceed, please refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information on how to submit your support request accurately.

Important: Please contact our billing team before filing a dispute with your bank. Filing a dispute or refund request directly with your bank for any Discord transactions may result in account suspension pending further investigation. 
For more information, please review our Chargeback FAQ. 

What this article covers:

  • What To Check First
  • What to Do When Someone You Know Makes an Unauthorized Discord Charge on Your Account
    • If the Charges are on Your Own Discord Account
    • If the Charges are on Someone Else's Discord Account
    • If You Have Access to Their Email
    • If You Cannot Access Their Email or Contact the Account Owner
  • What to Include in Your Support Request

What To Check First

Before submitting a support request, take a moment to review your recent transactions and purchases. Follow these steps to identify the Discord charges to ensure we provide the right assistance:

  • Look for "DISCORD*" or "PAYPAL DISCORD" on your bank statement—these are the official Discord payment descriptors.
  • For any unrecognized purchases made on Discord using your iOS device, you will need to request a refund for those purchases directly from the iOS App Store.
  • For any unrecognized purchases made on Discord using Google Play, you will also need to request a refund directly from the Google Play Store.

What to Do When Someone You Know Makes an Unauthorized Discord Charge on Your Account

To report unrecognized charges on your Discord account made by someone you know, follow the steps that match your situation:

If the Charges are on Your Own Discord Account

Check if the unrecognized charges appear on your own Discord account. If so, follow these steps: 

1. Submit a ticket using our support form.

2. Select "I have a question regarding my purchase/payment method" under Type of Billing Issue.

3. Select "I want a refund" under “How can we help you with your purchase?”.

If the Charges are on Someone Else's Discord Account

If the charges appear on another person's Discord account, have them submit a refund request at https://dis.gd/billing using the email address associated with their account. 

If You Have Access to Their Email

If the charges are on someone else's account and they can't submit a support request themselves, you can submit one on their behalf using the email address linked to their Discord account: 

1. In the support form, select “I have a question/issue regarding an unauthorized transaction” under Type of Billing Issue.  

2. Select “Family Member of a user” under Type of Issue. 

3. Select “Yes” when asked “Is the email provided associated with your family member's Discord account?”. 

If You Cannot Access Their Email or Contact the Account Owner

If you can't submit a support request from the email address associated with the Discord account or contact the account owner directly, follow these steps:

1. In the support form, select “I have a question/issue regarding an unauthorized transaction” under Type of Billing Issue.  

2. Select "Family Member of a user" under Type of Issue. 

3. Select “No” when asked “Is the email provided associated with your family member's Discord account?”.

4. Select “No” when asked “Do you have access to the email associated with your family member’s Discord account?”.  This will help us direct your request to the appropriate support team for further assistance.

Any refunds outside our standard refund policy may result in disabling your Discord account per our terms.

What to Include in Your Support Request

To help us resolve your case quickly, please provide:

  • Transaction date and amount
  • Purchase method (iOS App Store, Google Play Store, Other)
  • Payment method (credit card, PayPal, Cash App, Venmo, etc.)
  • Payment identifier (e.g., last 4 digits of credit card, PayPal invoice ID, $Cashtag, or Venmo User ID, etc.)
  • Screenshots of the Discord charges on your bank statement or PayPal statement

Please ensure the screenshot or photo displays the amount, date of transaction, and the merchant descriptor showing as DISCORD* or PAYPAL DISCORD on your bank statement.

For security and privacy reasons, unless you are writing in from the Discord account associated with the unrecognized charges, we do not accept Discord receipts as proof of payment. This screenshot must be directly from the payment source.

Any missing payment information may delay the resolution of your case.

Example of Submitting a Support Request

While we aim to resolve requests within 72 hours, some cases may take longer. To ensure the fastest possible response, please submit only one support ticket per issue—multiple tickets can delay our response time.

For more information, see these resources:

  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions

articles.name: What’s Changing for UK Users Due to the UK Online Safety Act
articles.title: What’s Changing for UK Users Due to the UK Online Safety Act
articles.body:
The United Kingdom's Online Safety Act (“OSA”) introduces new responsibilities for online platforms to reduce safety risks and provide age-appropriate experiences for users, especially teens. In compliance with the UK OSA, all new and existing UK users will be assigned updated default settings. 

These defaults include automatic content filtering (which is already enabled for teens everywhere) to reduce the likelihood that teens encounter certain types of potentially harmful content, as well as different social settings. UK users who wish to access content flagged by our filters or customize those settings can do so only after verifying that they are 18 or older through our new privacy-forward age verification experience. 

Our new privacy-forward age verification experience is required in specific scenarios that meet the OSA’s requirements (more details below), while building on our commitment to fostering genuine connections and a positive online experience. Check out our Safety Center article to learn more about why we are making these changes due to the UK OSA.

Age verification is only available to UK users and is a one-time process. Once completed, you won't need to verify again.

What this article covers:

  • Privacy-Forward Age Verification
  • Default Safety Settings
    • Content Default Settings Changes
    • Social Default Settings Changes
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Privacy-Forward Age Verification

Age verification is the backbone of this new experience for all new and existing UK users.  

  • Privacy-protecting process. Discord and k-ID do not permanently store personal identity documents or your video selfies. Images of your identity documents and ID match selfies are deleted directly after your age group is confirmed, and the video selfie used for facial age estimation never leaves your device.
  • Verify once. After completing verification, your Discord experience is tailored to your verified age group, and you won't be prompted again.
  • You can always re-verify. If you believe you’ve been incorrectly verified into the teen age group, you can attempt to re-verify.
  • Visible only to you. Other users can’t see your verification status or verified age group. That information is private to you.

If you have not already verified your age group, you will be prompted to age verify if you attempt to:

  • Unblur sensitive content flagged by our Sensitive Content Filter.
  • Change any of the default Sensitive Content Filter settings to “Show” sensitive content that’s blurred by the Sensitive Content Filter.
  • Turn off Message Requests (they are enabled by default to help you screen out unwanted DMs from your DM list).
  • Access age-restricted (18+) channels. 
To learn more about how to age verify, go to our How to Complete Age Verification on Discord article.

Default Safety Settings

All new and existing UK users will have enhanced default safety settings. Age verification may be required when you try to change certain settings or access specific content.

Content Default Settings Changes

  • Like before, the Sensitive Content Filter is enabled by default to help protect you from seeing unwanted sensitive and mature content. The default settings for this feature will blur content flagged in DMs with friends and messages in server channels, but it will block content flagged in DMs with strangers. Attempting to change these default settings to “Show” will require age verification.

Sensitive Content Filter Settings

  • Unblurring content flagged by our content filters will require age verification.
  • Attempting to enter an age-restricted (18+) channel will require age verification.

Social Default Settings Changes

  • Message Requests are enabled by default to help you screen out unwanted DMs from your DM list. Turning off Message Requests will require age verification.

Message Requests Setting in Content & Social Page

  • Your activity status by default will not be shared to large servers with 200+ members. You can update this setting at any time — age verification is not required to do so.

Activity Status Setting in Content & Social Page

  • You will be alerted before accepting a friend request from an unfamiliar user. You will receive the alert if you do not have any mutual friends or shared small servers (under 200 members) with the person who sent you the friend request. These alerts can help users make informed decisions about new connections. These alerts cannot be turned off at this time.

Accept friend request? Alert

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why is age verification only required for UK users?

A: We have been working hard to meet our obligations under the UK Online Safety Act. As this legislation comes into effect, UK users will experience new default settings designed to create a teen-appropriate experience by default, while maintaining a positive experience using the service.

While the Online Safety Act introduces new requirements specifically for UK users, these changes build on our existing safety architecture and represent our ongoing commitment to age-appropriate experiences worldwide.

Q: Does this apply to all UK Discord users?

A: The features and experiences described above apply to all new and existing UK accounts.

Q: What age verification methods are available?

A: There are two primary verification methods available:

  1. Face Scan: Uses your device's camera to verify your age group
  2. ID Scan: Allows you to scan an identification document

You can also request a manual review with our Trust & Safety team.

For detailed instructions on each method, please see our How to Complete Age Verification on Discord article.

Q: Is my personal data stored during the verification process?

A: Discord and k-ID do not permanently store personal identity documents or your video selfies. Images of your identity documents and ID match selfies are deleted directly after your age group is confirmed, and the video selfie used for facial age estimation never leaves your device.

Q: What if my age verification fails or shows incorrect results?

A: If verification fails or shows incorrect results, you have two options:

  1. Retry the verification through Discord system messages by selecting "Retry".
  2. Request a manual review through our support system.
For more information on handling verification issues, visit our How to Complete Age Verification on Discord article.

Q: Do I need to verify my age every time I access age-restricted content or attempt to update a default setting?

A: No. Age verification is a one-time process. Once your age group is confirmed, you won't need to verify again. If you are verified into the teen age group (13-17 years old), you will not be able to adjust the settings described above until you verify as at least 18 years old. 

Q: What happens if I'm verified as under 18?

A: If you're verified as under 18, certain default safety settings will remain in place that cannot be changed. These include sensitive content filters, message request settings and restrictions when attempting to access age-restricted channels.

Q: Can I appeal if I believe my account was incorrectly age-restricted?

A: Yes. If you believe you were incorrectly verified into the teen age group, you may retry the verification process or submit an appeal for a manual review. 

Q: What happens if I’m verified as too young to be on Discord?

A: Your account will be banned if you are under 13 years of age. If you believe we made a mistake, you can make an appeal.

For details on appealing, check our How to Complete Age Verification on Discord article.

Q: Are there plans to add these changes to other regions in the world?

A: Supporting our users’ well-being is at the heart of our work here at Discord. While this update is focused on UK users, we continue to invest in features that create age-appropriate experiences for our global community as we work with key stakeholders across the industry, as well as parents, digital wellness experts and regulators worldwide. Every region has different needs, and we’re committed to building experiences that empower users as they continue to use our platform.

articles.name: How to Report an Unrecognized Charge on Your Discord Account
articles.title: How to Report an Unrecognized Charge on Your Discord Account
articles.body:
If you have a charge you do not recognize on your Discord account, we’re here to help. Please read through the rest of this Help Center article to ensure a thorough resolution.

Before you proceed, please refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information on how to accurately submit your support request.

What this article covers:

  • Steps to Take if Your Discord Account Has Unrecognized Charges
  • How to Report Unrecognized Charges that Appear on Your Discord Account
  • Additional Payment Details to Include in Your Support Request

Steps to Take if Your Discord Account Has Unrecognized Charges

First, check if the charge appears on any of your Discord accounts (including any alternate accounts) before contacting our support team about an unrecognized payment. This step ensures we can take appropriate account-level actions that match your situation.

If you can't find the charge on your Discord account(s), this may indicate that your payment method (credit card, PayPal, CashApp, etc.) was used without your permission.

Important: Please contact our billing team before filing a dispute with your bank. Filing a dispute or refund request directly with your bank for any Discord transactions may result in account suspension pending further investigation. For more information, please review our Chargeback FAQ.

How to Report Unrecognized Charges that Appear on Your Discord Account

To report unrecognized charges on your Discord account, follow the steps that match your situation:

Discord Account with Access to Email Address

If you've confirmed the unrecognized charges are from your Discord account and you have access to the email address associated with the account, follow these steps to report them:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Under Type of Billing Issue?, select “I have a question/issue regarding an unauthorized transaction”

3. Select "I do not recognize a charge on my Discord account" under the Type of Issue category

4. Select "Yes" when asked if you're using the email address linked to your Discord account

Discord Account without Access to Email Address

If you do not have access to the email address associated with your Discord account, please take the following steps:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Under Type of Billing Issue?, select “I have a question/issue regarding an unauthorized transaction”

3. Select "I do not recognize a charge on my Discord account" under the Type of Issue category

4. Select "No" when asked if you're using the email address linked to your Discord account

5. Select "No" again when asked if you can submit a ticket from your Discord account's email

Possible Hacked Account with Email Change

If you believe your Discord account has been hacked/compromised and someone has changed your email tied to the account:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Choose "Hacked Account" from the What can we help you with? drop-down menu

3. Enter your email address

4. Enter the username and email address originally associated with the Discord account before the account was compromised. (Please also include the UserID associated with the Discord account if possible)

5. Select the reason for how you believe the account was compromised from the dropdown menu

6. Select “Yes” when asked if your email associated with the Discord account was changed

This will forward your request to the team that is best equipped to help with account recovery.

Additional Payment Details to Include in Your Support Request

To help us resolve your case quickly, please provide:

  • Transaction date and amount
  • Payment method (credit card, PayPal, Cash App, Venmo, etc.)
  • Payment identifier (last 4 digits of credit card, PayPal invoice ID, $Cashtag, Venmo User ID, etc.)
  • Screenshots of the Discord charges on your bank statement
Any missing payment information may delay the resolution of your case.

Example of Submitting a Support Request

While we aim to resolve requests within 72 hours, some cases may take longer. To ensure the fastest possible response, please submit only one support ticket per issue—multiple tickets can delay our response time. 

For more information, see these resources:

  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions
  • Discord’s Refund Policy
  • Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
  • Chargebacks FAQ

These resources cover unrecognized transactions, refund policies, and safe shopping practices on Discord.

articles.name: Discord Voice, Video, & Streaming Guide
articles.title: Discord Voice, Video, & Streaming Guide
articles.body:
Whether you're experiencing issues with voice, video, or streaming on Discord, this guide offers basic troubleshooting steps and links to additional resources for further support.

What this article covers:

  • Discord Voice Troubleshooting
    • Voice Troubleshooting Additional Resources
  • Discord Video Troubleshooting
    • Video Troubleshooting Additional Resources
  • Discord Streaming & Screen Share Troubleshooting
    • Streaming & Screen Share Additional Resources

Discord Voice Troubleshooting

If you're experiencing issues with voice chat on Discord, follow this step-by-step guide to help diagnose and resolve common problems.

1. Check Your Microphone and Headset

  • Ensure your microphone or headset is properly connected to your device.
  • If using a USB microphone, try plugging it into a different port.
  • Test your microphone with another app to confirm it’s working.

2. Verify Input and Output Devices in Discord

2a. To check your input devices through the desktop/browser app, tap on the cogwheel icon [] in the lower-left corner of the app to access your User Settings.

Cogwheel icon on Discord desktop/browser

2b. Tap on the Voice & Video tab. Make sure the correct Input Device and Output Device are selected. If you’re having trouble with your microphone not working while using the Discord app on desktop/browser, you can also run a Mic Test.

Example of the Input and Outside Device settings under the Voice & Video tab

2c. On the Discord mobile app, tap on your avatar in the bottom-right corner. Then tap on the cogwheel in the top-right corner to access User Settings.

2d. While under User Settings, scroll down and tap on Voice under App Settings. Here you can check your Input settings to ensure the correct Input Mode is selected (Voice Activity or Push to Talk).

Where to find Voice settings on mobile

2e. On the mobile app, you can adjust the Output volume and see if enabling or disabled additional settings helps.

3. Make sure you’re not Muted or Deafened

Double-check to ensure you haven’t accidentally muted or deafened yourself. You can check this on desktop/browser by looking to the right-hand side of your avatar in the bottom-left corner of the app.

Example of what it looks like when you are muted and deafened in Discord on the desktop app/browser

4. Check for any Discord app updates

Ensure you're using the latest version of the app, whether on desktop or mobile, to maintain compatibility and access the latest features.

Voice Troubleshooting Additional Resources

If you’re still running into issues with voice, here are some additional resources that can assist you with further troubleshooting and other features you can learn more about.

  • Krisp FAQ: Learn more about Krisp. How to enable it and use it while in a Discord Voice Channel.
  • Voice Regions on Discord FAQ: Learn how to set a Voice Region for a Voice Channel in Discord.
  • Mic Testing: Having trouble with your microphone in Discord? Try using Mic Testing to further troubleshoot your microphone and hear how you sound to others.
  • Discord Soundboard Guide: Using, Adding, and Managing Sounds: Learn how to use, upload, and manage Soundboard sounds.
  • How do I enable/disable Push-to-talk activation noise?: Learn how to set a sound for when you use Push-to-Talk in Discord.
  • Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide: A comprehensive troubleshooting guide for Voice and Video.
  • Voice Channels FAQs: Learn how to Voice Chat on Discord.

Discord Video Troubleshooting

If you're experiencing issues with sharing your video or viewing someone else's on Discord, this guide will help you get started with some troubleshooting steps.

1. Check Video device settings

1a. If your video is not displaying for others, the first thing you want to check is that the correct camera device is selected. 

Where to locate your camera settings under Voice & Video tab

1b. If the correct device is selected, please double-check the following:

  • Ensure your camera is properly connected to your device and try another port.
  • If using an external webcam, try unplugging and reconnecting it.

Test the camera in another application to confirm it’s working.

2. Check for any updates

Ensure you're using the latest version of the app, whether on desktop or mobile, to maintain compatibility and access the latest features.

If you have software installed for your webcam, check to make sure it doesn’t have any outstanding updates as well.

Video Troubleshooting Additional Resources

If you’re still running into issues with Discord video, here are some additional resources that can not only assist you with further troubleshooting, but also allow you to learn more about additional features.

  • Video Calls: Learn how to set up your camera for video calls
  • Video Backgrounds: Learn how to set and use a Video Background.
  • Video Upload Quality Settings on Mobile FAQ: Learn more about video upload settings on mobile.
  • Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide: A comprehensive troubleshooting guide for Voice and Video while using Discord.

Discord Streaming & Screen Share Troubleshooting

If you’re running into any issues with screen sharing or streaming, here are some settings to check.

1. Check your Internet Connection

  • Ensure you have a stable internet connection to prevent lag or disconnections.
  • If possible, use a wired connection for better stability.

2. Restart Discord and Your Device & Check for Updates

  • Close and reopen Discord to refresh the app.
  • If the issue persists, restart your computer or mobile device.
  • Make sure you’re also running the latest version of the Discord app.

3. Disable Hardware Acceleration

If you have Hardware Acceleration on, and you find your stream is lagging, please try disabling this setting to see if it helps. 

3a. Tap on the cogwheel icon [] in the lower-left corner of the app to access your User Settings in the desktop/browser app.

Cogwheel icon on Discord desktop/browser

3b. Press on Voice & Video then tap on the Video tab. While here, scroll down until you see the Hardware Acceleration setting. If enabled, tap on the check mark to disable. 

Example of where the Hardware Acceleration setting is located under the Voice & Video tab

4. Grant Necessary Permissions

Make sure that your desktop device has all of the necessary permissions to be able to screen share in Discord.

Windows:

  • Run Discord as an administrator by right-clicking the Discord icon and selecting Run as administrator.
  • Check Settings > Privacy > Screen Recording to ensure Discord has permission to record the screen.

macOS:

  • Go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy.
  • Under Screen Recording, ensure Discord is checked.

Streaming & Screen Share Additional Resources

  • How to Screen Share on MacOS: Learn how to Screen Share through MacOS on Discord.
  • Go Live and Screen Share: Full guide on how to Screen Share and stream your favorite games to your friends.
  • [Mobile] Screenshare FAQ: Learn how to Screen Share through your mobile devices.
  • Game Overlay 101: Learn more about how to use Game Overlay while gaming and chatting with friends on Discord.
  • Streamer Mode 101: Learn more about using the setting Streamer Mode to ensure certain personal details aren’t viewed by others while you’re streaming.
  • Using Discord's OBS Streamkit Overlay: Learn how to install and use the OBS Streamkit Overlay.
  • Using Discord's XSplit Streamkit Overlay: Learn how to install and use the XSplit Streamkit Overlay.
  • Video Codec FAQ: Learn more about how to use Video Codec.
  • Mobile Voice Overlay (Android)
  • Clips: Learn how to capture, share, and edit Clips that you’ve taken while streaming.
  • Video & Screenshare Updates - Multistream and More!: Learn more about multi-streaming and other Video and Screen Share updates on Discord.
  • How to Screen Share and Go Live on Discord: Learn how to stream video on Discord and more!
Contact Us: If you’re still running into an issue with Voice, Video, or Streaming on Discord, you can reach out to Support team for further assistance: dis.gd/contact
